title: Lamar County Airport
text:
Lamar County Airport is a public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> in <a href="Lamar%20County%2C%20Alabama">Lamar County</a>, <a href="Alabama">Alabama</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. It is owned by the Lamar County Commission and located six <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (7 <a href="mile">mi</a>, 11 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) north of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Vernon%2C%20Alabama">Vernon, Alabama</a>.
Facilities and aircraft.
Lamar County Airport covers an area of 75 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (30 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 463 feet (141 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 17/35 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 3,613 by 75 feet (1,101 x 23 m).
For the 12-month period ending August 19, 2008, the airport had 1,604 <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> aircraft operations, an average of 31 per week. At that time there were five aircraft based at this airport, all single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a>.
